title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.27 - Executive Order No. 27: Extending the Period for Paying School District Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Albany and Orange
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.27 - Executive Order No. 27: Extending the Period for Paying School District Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Albany and Orange

State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on August 27, 2011 and continuing
thereafter, Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee brought torrential rainfall
causing record flooding and storm surge throughout the State of New

York; WHEREAS, on September 19, 2011 and September 29, 2011, as a
result of the personal hardships caused by Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm

Lee, I issued Executive Order Nos. 23 and 24 extending the period for paying
without interest or penalty the real property taxes that are due on or about

September 30, 2011 in certain school districts in the counties of Broome, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Hamilton, Orange, Schenectady, Schoharie, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster and Washington; WHEREAS, since September 19, 2011, additional requests for
an extension of the period for paying school district taxes for the 2011-2012
school year have been received by the Governor's Office on behalf of (i)

Berne-Knox-Westerlo Central School District located within Albany County and
(ii) Goshen Central School District, Chester Union Free Central School District
and Port Jervis Central School District, all located within Orange

County; WHEREAS, school district taxes for the 2011-2012 school
year were due on or about September 30, 2011 in the aforementioned school
districts; WHEREAS, section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law authorizes the Governor to extend the period for
paying such taxes without interest or penalty upon request of the chief
executive officer of an affected county, city, town, village or school district
during a State disaster emergency; WHEREAS, given the difficulties continuing to confront the
residents of the aforementioned counties, such an extension is eminently
warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Andrew M. Cuomo, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby extend the period for paying without
interest or penalty the school district taxes that were due on or about

September 30, 2011 in the afore-mentioned school districts within the
aforementioned counties for twenty-one days from the final date such taxes were
currently due; FURTHER, this Executive Order may be revised and amended to
extend the period for paying school taxes for school districts within the
counties adversely affected by Hurricane Irene or Tropical Storm Lee. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: October 7, 2011
